Award.AwardTitle: I-Corps: ViQi - online scientific data analysis platform
Award.AbstractNarration:
Scientific Imaging is fundamental to many disciplines and is no longer solely subjected to informal and subjective interpretation, but has become a source of quantitative evidence. While digital imaging platforms have progressed to the point where they deliver terabytes of data per experiment, our ability to manage, process and interpret images has been neglected. This team believes that quantitative digital image analysis will be required in many distinct scientific disciplines (e.g., medical, agricultural, construction, environmental monitoring), yet current tools are not well designed for handling the massive increase in data size and complexity. Robust image processing workflows have the potential to transform image-based sciences such as microscopy, medical imaging, ecology, and remote sensing. This project will develop an on-line web-based extensible platform for biological and other scientific image-processing. The platform will simplify sharing and management of vast amounts of scientific images and associated metadata.

Large-scale data processing remains difficult for the general scientist without access to specialized programmers and hardware systems. The accessibility and relative low cost of the Cloud has changed the availability of the hardware, yet accessible and easy-to-use software is still lacking. The proposed platform, ViQi, will fill this gap by providing a cost-effective platform to organize, store, and analyze large multi-modal datasets. The core product will be based on the open-source platform BisQue, while providing necessary tools to particular industries including small-scale biotechs, big pharma, and possible agriculture studies. ViQi has the potential to expand the use of image processing methods to non-experts while allowing developers to create customized workflows for a broad array of application areas. As a cost-effective, cloud-based resource, ViQi.org will facilitate participation of diverse groups allowing them to address questions that would otherwise require expensive software.

POR.DRECONTENT:
ViQi is a provider of big image data analysis and management solutions for lifesciences, construction, agriculture and other industries with massive image analysis needs. ViQi offers these solutions as custom development for intranet deployment and as a cloud based solution for easy setup, access, and maintenance. All of ViQi’s solutions are highly scalable and designed to adapt to specific data and analysis needs.

ViQi’s platform comes with a number of cutting edge visualization tools that scale to very large image sizes and work in any browser without any installation requirements.

Many viewers are already included and the list is growing:

  • 5D image viewer with multi-channel support for very large images
  • movie viewer with the capability to create movies from z-stack images on the fly
  • fully web-based 3D image viewer with full channel fusion, intensity enhancements and editable transfer function with several presets
  • 3D small molecule and protein viewer
  • heat map viewer for visual discovery of patterns in large datasets

ViQi’s platform supports many different data types from 5D images, videos, hierarchical tag documents, and geometric primitives to geospatial and molecular data. This allows users of the platform to search and discover across all these modalities. For example, it is possible to correlate features of interest from mouse brain slice images with the 3D structure of lead molecules administered and their dosage to identify promising leads for drug discovery. Similarly, images of cells of certain types that are in close proximity of other cell types (e.g., tumor cells next to blood vessels) can be discovered by querying over image textures and geometric primitives. Any of these multi-modal searching and mining capabilities work seamlessly across any size images and across millions of images.

All data types are stored and queried through the same ViQi interface. Any data can be shared with any number of collaborators and arbitrarily nested tags/values can be attached to any resource stored in ViQi. In addition to user provided data, ViQi tracks analysis runs, data updates, and any other interactions and allows users to inspect this provenance for any resource in the system. Furthermore, any past version of any data item can be examined. Even queries can be run on historic data for easy repeatability of analysis runs.

ViQi makes collaborating on large image and data sets as easy as the click of a button. Other users can view, annotate, and analyze any resources that have been shared with them. ViQi also provides the capability to maintain collaborative groups with all members having specific access rights. This sharing works seamlessly for groups in the same office or in different parts of the world. This is a powerful new way to jointly work on very large image and data resources.

In addition, ViQi’s platform tracks all changes in a provenance structure that allows easy identification of who made which change or which analysis was run to generate specific outputs. This is a great way to explore various analysis routes in a large team and then trace back the steps of the most successful ones.

ViQi’s platform provides facilities to integrate existing and new analysis solutions (written in different languages such as Matlab, Python, C++, R) and then share them with others. This allows other users to run the same analysis on their own datasets, without having to program or install any module.

ViQi’s Analysis Marketplace is a platform for analysis writers to offer novel image analysis algorithms to other users for a fee. The underlying ViQi platform takes care of all payment processing, module execution, and result delivery. Analysis writers can set their own price and get paid per analysis run. Analysis modules are designed to run on any data type supported by ViQi’s platform. Analysis module users can search for modules by functionality, input types, and more, in order to discover useful analysis routines for their task.



Last Modified: 03/01/2018
Modified by: Kristian Kvilekval
